text:
Overview Tour
When you first log into the portal a pop-up will appear to take a “tour “of the portal. You can exit out of the tour at any point and re-start the tour by clicking the ‘Start Tour’ button. 

Once the tour has started click ‘Next’ to progress or ‘Exit’ to stop the tour.
05

blocks.content:
When you first log into the portal a pop-up will appear to take a “tour “of the portal. You can exit out of the tour at any point and re-start the tour by clicking the ‘Start Tour’ button. 

Once the tour has started click ‘Next’ to progress or ‘Exit’ to stop the tour.

In this tab you can view a broad overview of results. View dimension scores and their related items, as well as other available analyses like Most Favorable and Most Unfavorable items, Action Priorities, Most Improved and Most Declined items (based on trend). 

Note: Click on the top right three vertical dots in any module to download an Excel version or take a screenshot.
Dashboard- Overview
Click on the  arrow to see the details for each module.
Our Action Prioritization algorithm identifies three items that, if acted upon, will have the greatest impact. These items were chosen by analyzing your results and taking organizational strategies into account and focus on issues where you will be able to create real change.

text:
Dashboard- Dimensions
In this tab you can view all dimension results. 
This tab shows results for all survey dimensions, and (if available) trends and comparisons. You can sort the results using the up and down arrows at the top of the chart. Use the arrow to the left of each dimension to display its questions.

Note: Click on the top right three vertical dots in any module to download an Excel version or take a screenshot.
Click on the arrow to view the results for each survey question within each dimension.

text:
Dashboard- Heatmap
In this tab you can view all dimension & question results. 
The Heatmap shows the main group and subgroup results side by side. Shading represents meaningful differences OR Strengths & Red Flags. 

Note: Click on the top right three vertical dots in any module to download an Excel version or take a screenshot.
Choose shading preference for the heatmap by clicking the button.
Click on the arrow to view the results for each survey question within each dimension.

text:
Dashboard- Comments
In this tab you can view all comments and themes. 
This tab shows responses to the open-ended survey items. Use the dropdown list to select a question. Comments can also be exported to Excel.

Note: Click on the top right three vertical dots in any module to download an Excel version.
Use the dropdown to view the open-ended questions and responses.
Search for comments here.
For questions that allowed for self selected themes use the dropdown to filter by theme.

In this tab you can view all comments and themes. 
This tab shows responses to the open-ended survey items. Use the dropdown list to select a question. Comments can also be exported to Excel.

Note: Click on the top right three vertical dots in any module to download an Excel version.

text:
Manage Reports- Report Library
In the Report Library you can view all pre-generated reports (based on access permissions), as well as view any custom reports you have generated.

To send a report to another person via the portal, select the report(s) by checking the box next to the report name(s), then click here to search for and choose the recipient. The recipient must already have access to the portal.
Filter using the column headers by clicking on the arrows.
Search for a report by typing the name in the search field. Partial name searches work best.
Click to expand the report to view groups included in the report.
Click to download the PowerPoint Report.
Click to go to the Dashboard and view results for this report.
Refresh the Report Library view.
2
1
3
7
5
6
4
12

blocks.content:
In the Report Library you can view all pre-generated reports (based on access permissions), as well as view any custom reports you have generated.

To send a report to another person via the portal, select the report(s) by checking the box next to the report name(s), then click here to search for and choose the recipient. The recipient must already have access to the portal.
Filter using the column headers by clicking on the arrows.
Search for a report by typing the name in the search field. Partial name searches work best.
Click to expand the report to view groups included in the report.
Click to download the PowerPoint Report.
Click to go to the Dashboard and view results for this report.
Refresh the Report Library view.

text:
Dashboard- Comments
In this tab you can view all comments, themes, sentiment, and Usability Quotient (UQ). 
This tab shows responses to the open-ended survey items. Use the dropdown list to select a question. There is also a dropdown to filter by theme, Sentiment, and/or UQ. Comments can also be exported to Excel.

Note: Click on the top right three vertical dots in any module to download an Excel version.
Use the dropdown to view the open-ended questions and responses.
View and filter by UQ scores. This is a ranking to determine how actionable a comment is. From highly actionable to somewhat actionable.
For questions that allowed for self selected themes use the dropdown to filter by theme.
View and filter by sentiment.
Search for comment’s here.
16

In this tab you can view all comments, themes, sentiment, and Usability Quotient (UQ). 
This tab shows responses to the open-ended survey items. Use the dropdown list to select a question. There is also a dropdown to filter by theme, Sentiment, and/or UQ. Comments can also be exported to Excel.

Note: Click on the top right three vertical dots in any module to download an Excel version.

text:
Action Planning- New Action Planning
Create Actions for yourself or others based on access. 

Option 1: Choose actions from the Suggested Priorities that are pre-populated.
Option 2: Choose action based on All Survey items. Suggested priority actions will show a star next to them.
Option 3: (**If present) Choose from company wide Required Items. 

Once you select an item more options will appear underneath. 
A. Action Ideas to choose from/help guide you. If you select one, it will pre-populate in the open text box.
B. Write in and describe your planned actions or add to the Action Idea.
C. Create a Target Completion date by using the calendar pop up.
D. Choose from the Reminder Type options
E. Choose the action plans Status.
F. Click ‘Save and Finish’ or ‘Save and Add Another’ when done.
G. You can also use the ‘Clear Action’ button to start again.
3

2

blocks.content:
Create Actions for yourself or others based on access. 

Option 1: Choose actions from the Suggested Priorities that are pre-populated.
Option 2: Choose action based on All Survey items. Suggested priority actions will show a star next to them.
Option 3: (**If present) Choose from company wide Required Items. 

Once you select an item more options will appear underneath. 
A. Action Ideas to choose from/help guide you. If you select one, it will pre-populate in the open text box.
B. Write in and describe your planned actions or add to the Action Idea.
C. Create a Target Completion date by using the calendar pop up.
D. Choose from the Reminder Type options
E. Choose the action plans Status.
F. Click ‘Save and Finish’ or ‘Save and Add Another’ when done.
G. You can also use the ‘Clear Action’ button to start again.

text:
Action Planning- Review Action Planning
Review your action plan or action plans created by someone else, based on access. 

Use the tab- Review and Update My Actions. Click on the action boxes to view/update your action plans. 
Save new changes/updates.
Delete an action plan.
Use the three vertical dots to ‘Add Action’ or download actions to excel.

Review your action plan or action plans created by someone else, based on access. 

Use the tab- Review and Update My Actions. Click on the action boxes to view/update your action plans. 
Save new changes/updates.
